32 Task * createSchedulerTask(const strands_executive_msgs::Task & _task, const ros::Time & _earliestStart, const bool & _demand=false) {
33 
34 
35  auto startAfter = _earliestStart > _task.start_after ? _earliestStart : _task.start_after;
36 
37  // ROS_INFO_STREAM("" << _earliestStart);
38  // ROS_INFO_STREAM("" << _task.start_after);
39  // ROS_INFO_STREAM("" << startAfter);
40 
41 
42  Task* t = new Task(_task.task_id,
43  startAfter.toSec(),
44  _task.end_before.toSec(),
45  _task.max_duration.toSec(),
46  _task.start_node_id,
47  _task.end_node_id,
48  _demand);
49 
50  return t;
51 }

53 // bool compareTasks (const Task * i, const Task * j) {
54 bool compareTasks ( Task * i, Task * j) {
55  return (i->getExecTime()<j->getExecTime());
56 }

58 double ** createDurationArray(const strands_executive_msgs::DurationMatrix & dm, double & max) {
59 
60  double ** array = new double *[dm.durations.size()];
61 
62  for(int i = 0; i < dm.durations.size(); ++i) {
63  const strands_executive_msgs::DurationList & dl(dm.durations[i]);
64  array[i] = new double [dl.durations.size()];
65  for (int j = 0; j < dl.durations.size(); ++j)
66  {
67  array[i][j] = dl.durations[j].toSec();
68  }
69  }
70 
71  return array;
72 }

74 bool getSchedule(strands_executive_msgs::GetSchedule::Request &req,
75  strands_executive_msgs::GetSchedule::Response &res) {
76 
77  ROS_INFO_STREAM("Got a request for a schedule " << req.tasks.size() << " tasks ");
78 
79  static ros::NodeHandle nh;
80 
81 
82  std::vector<Task*> tasks;
83 
84 
85 
86  // for(strands_executive_msgs::Task task : req.tasks) {
87  for(auto & task : req.tasks) {
88  // ROS_INFO_STREAM(task.task_id << " start " << task.start_after << ", end " << task.end_before
89  // << ", duration " << task.max_duration);
90 
91  bool first = task.task_id == req.first_task ? true : false;
92 
93  tasks.push_back(createSchedulerTask(task, req.earliest_start, first));
94  if(first) {
95  ROS_INFO_STREAM(task.task_id << " is first");
96  }
97  }
98 
99 
100  if(save_problems) {
101 
102  static MessageStoreProxy messageStore(nh, "scheduling_problems");
103 
104  vector< pair<string, string> > stored;
105 
106  for(auto & task : req.tasks) {
107  static string taskType(get_ros_type(task));
108  stored.push_back( make_pair(taskType, messageStore.insert(task)) );
109  }
110 
111  StringPairList spl;
112  for(auto & pair : stored) {
113  spl.pairs.push_back(mongodb_store::makePair(pair.first, pair.second));
114  }
115  messageStore.insert(spl);
116  }
117 
118 
119  double max_duration;
120  double ** duration_array = createDurationArray(req.durations, max_duration);
121  Scheduler scheduler(&tasks, duration_array, max_duration);
122 
123  ROS_INFO_STREAM("Going to solve");
124 
125 
126  if(scheduler.solve(scheduler_version, output_file, timeout)) {
127 
128 
129 
130  std::sort(tasks.begin(), tasks.end(), compareTasks);
131 
132 
133  // clean up duration matrix... yuck! Lenka, smart pointers or, ideally, boost matrix
134  for (int i = 0; i < tasks.size(); ++i)
135  {
136  delete duration_array[i];
137  }
138  delete duration_array;
139 
140 
141  for(auto & tp : tasks) {
142  res.task_order.push_back(tp->getID());
143  res.execution_times.push_back(ros::Time(tp->getExecTime()));
144  delete tp;
145  }
146 
147  }
148  else {
149 
150 
151 
152  // clean up duration matrix... yuck! Lenka, smart pointers or, ideally, boost matrix
153  for (int i = 0; i < tasks.size(); ++i)
154  {
155  delete duration_array[i];
156  }
157  delete duration_array;
158 
159  // manage memory explicitly until Lenka changes to smart pointers
160  for(auto & tp : tasks) {
161  delete tp;
162  }
163  }
164 
165 
166  return true;
167 }

171 int main(int argc, char **argv)
172 {
173  ros::init(argc, argv, "schedule_server");
174 
175  if(ros::param::has("~save_problems")) {
176  ros::param::get("~save_problems", save_problems);
177  }
178 
179  if(ros::param::has("~scheduler_version")) {
180  ros::param::get("~scheduler_version", scheduler_version);
181  ROS_INFO_STREAM("Running scheduler version " << scheduler_version);
182  }
183 
184  if(ros::param::has("~output_file")) {
185  ros::param::get("~output_file", output_file);
186  ROS_INFO_STREAM("Saving experimental output to " << output_file);
187  }
188 
189  if(ros::param::has("~timeout")) {
190  ros::param::get("~timeout", timeout);
191  ROS_INFO_STREAM("Using timeout " << timeout);
192  }
193 
194  if(save_problems) {
195  ROS_INFO("Writing scheduling problems to mongodb_store");
196  }
197  else{
198  ROS_INFO("Not writing scheduling problems to mongodb_store");
199  }
200 
201  ros::NodeHandle nh;
202 
203  ros::ServiceServer service = nh.advertiseService("get_schedule", getSchedule);
204  ROS_INFO("Ready to serve schedules");
205  ros::spin();
206 
207  return 0;
208 }
